title.narrative: OUTPUT 3: CHILD PROTECTION REFFERAL SYSTEMS IN DEVELOPMENTAL AND EMERGENCY SITUAT

description.narrative: By 2022, at least three provinces and one territory establish effective mechanisms to receive, monitor and investigate reports of cases of child abuse, including referral where necessary in developmental and emergency situations., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, 65 % of girls and boys under-5 are registered in Pakistan, with universal birth registration achieved and embedded within civil registration and vital statistics (CRVS) systems in two provinces, children access appropriate child protection preventive and/or response services, primarily through public case management and referral system in at least two provinces, and communities practice positive behaviours contributing towards a protective environment for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, at least three provinces and one territory establish effective mechanisms to receive, monitor and investigate reports ofcases of child abuse, including referral where necessary in developmental and emergency situations.

description.narrative: In partnership with National Commission on the Rights of the Child, child protection bills, aligned with CRC and its Committee’s Recommendations were drafted for Punjab and KP, the Sindh CP Authority Amendment Act 2021 was enacted, and rules finalized for the ICT Child Protection Act 2018. UNICEF technical assistance to the government resulted in continued operationalization of CP-CMRS in Balochistan and GB with regular mentoring and monitoring support. CPIMS was field-tested and prepared for deployment in 2022. In Sindh and ICT, CP-CMRS package was validated prior to implementation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:04/01/2022

title.narrative: of children and adults (with segregation by age, gender, demographic location) provided with prevention or response interventions and services to address their mental health and psychosocial support needs;(59570), Text

baseline.value: 17,46 patients including 572 women, 498 men, 304 boys and 372 girls;

title.narrative: No. of provincial/territorial governments(59569), Text

baseline.value: CP Act 2015 (Balochistan) fully aligned with CRC;

target.value: 2022:CP legislation aligned with the CRC (Punjab, KP); Finalized design of child protection case management and referral system (Sindh, KP, Punjab, ICT, PAK); CPIMS established in Balochistan, GB, Sindh, ICT; Training of Trainers

actual.value: 2021:Sindh CP Authority Amendment Act 2021 enacted; CRC-aligned bills available for KP and Punjab; CPCMRS design finalized for Balochistan, GB, Sindh, ICT
